title: 108_hr3767
content: The Act titled "Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004" establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option. Starting in 2006, the Secretary will offer one or more plans with a nationwide service area and negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers to reduce drug costs for eligible individuals. The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 introduces a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option. The plan aims to reduce drug costs for eligible individuals by offering qualified prescription drug coverage and access to negotiated prices. The monthly beneficiary premium for qualified prescription drug coverage under a Medicare operated prescription drug plan will be uniform nationally. The premium for 2006 is $35, and for future years, it will be based on the average monthly per capita actuarial cost. The Secretary may adjust the premium for supplemental prescription drug coverage. There must be at least one plan with a $35 premium. The Secretary must ensure that at least one Medicare operated prescription drug plan offered in 2006 has a monthly premium of $35. This plan must be available nationally and will be part of the Medicare prescription drug coverage. The Secretary may designate a Medicare operated prescription drug plan as the fallback plan for certain service areas, as defined in section 1860D-11(g)(3). The Secretary may designate a Medicare operated prescription drug plan as the fallback plan for certain service areas, as defined in section 1860D-11(g)(3). Section 1860D-13(c)(3) and Section 1860D-16(b)(1) of the Act are amended to include Medicare operated prescription drug plans. The amendments made by this section relate to Medicare operated prescription drug plans under the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. The term 'medicare operated prescription drug plan' is defined in section 1860D-11A(c). The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the mentioned Act.
